summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling its previous resolutions on Kosovo, particularly 1244 (1999) and 1345 (2001),
Noting satisfaction that conditions listed in resolution 1160 (1998) have been met,
Noting the Secretary-General's letter of 6 September 2001 (S/2001/849),
Noting the difficult security situation along Kosovo's borders,
Emphasizing the continuing authority of the Secretary-General's Special Representative and KFOR Commander to control the flow of arms,
Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter,
1. Decides to terminate the prohibitions established by paragraph 8 of resolution 1160 (1998);
2. Decides to dissolve the Committee established by paragraph 9 of resolution 1160 (1998).
